title: Upgrading the software/firmware on your Tesla-Style Screen (G-Series, MK6, NiftyCity)

topLevelComment.text:
"You live, you learn, and you upgrade."
- Abraham Lincoln
topLevelComment.author: @SquareWheelsAuto

topLevelComment.text: I upgraded my unit last week to the Mark 6 and at first, I was frustrated because I was trying to get the unit to be like the factory setting and had to stop thinking that way. Once I start using this unit like it was intended, I was blown away! My advice, be patient and work through the initial frustrations and enjoy! I love this unit with no issues! Rob was amazing....
topLevelComment.author: @randeharris2760

replies.text:
Thrilled to hear you're loving your 6, Rande!! These things definitely have a bit of a learning curve, but you kept an open mind and got up to speed super quick üôåüèæüôåüèæ

Thx for the kind words, ENJOY!!!

topLevelComment.author: @devonkearse3571

topLevelComment.text:
I was having issues with the updater not launching. What ended up working for me was...
1. Plugging in the USB to the screen first. (Android puts a bunch of files on the drive.)
2. Copying the update file to the root of the USB.
3. Plugged into the screen and the updated launched as it should.

topLevelComment.text: Hey quick question. i already have hit them up about it but wanted some insight. i installed been running for weeks no issues at all. this morning i start up and the screen does not display anything but it is working cause you can see the back light, all the buttons are working fine just noting is displaying. any clue?
topLevelComment.author: @JavierValdez-z8y

replies.text: These things benefit from periodic reboots just like phones and computers.  Hold down the physical home button for like 10s to force a reboot and you should be back up and running.
replies.author: @SquareWheelsAuto

replies.text: glad to know, i just unpluged the car battery and it booted up but now that i know that if it occurs again i will do that instead. thank you for the help and quick response @SquareWheelsAuto
replies.author: @JavierValdez-z8y

replies.text: @JavierValdez-z8y  did disconnecting your battery resolve your issue? I have the same issue, but disconnecting the battery for 3 hours didn't fix my issue so I'm curious what came of your troubleshooting
replies.author: @marklowe6352

replies.text: yea it did, if it didnt work hold the home button for 10 or 12 seconds and see if that reboots it. otherwise contact support. they got back to me in a day or less but by than i fixed it with the battery @marklowe6352
replies.author: @JavierValdez-z8y
